name: Seven-Point Story Structure
description: Dan Wells' structure focusing on character arc through seven key plot points. Balances plot progression with character development
distribution_philosophy: Structured around seven major plot points with character development woven throughout each section

hook.name: Hook
hook.description: Establish character in their starting state, opposite of where they'll end

plot_turn_1.name: Plot Turn 1 (Inciting Incident)
plot_turn_1.description: Something happens that changes the character's situation

pinch_point_1.name: Pinch Point 1
pinch_point_1.description: Apply pressure, show the power of the opposition

midpoint.name: Midpoint (Plot Turn 2)
midpoint.description: Character moves from reaction to action, or gains new information

pinch_point_2.name: Pinch Point 2
pinch_point_2.description: Apply more pressure, show opposition's ultimate power

plot_turn_3.name: Plot Turn 3 (Crisis)
plot_turn_3.description: Character's final piece of information or tool needed for resolution

resolution.name: Resolution
resolution.description: Character reaches their ending state, opposite of where they started
